transportAdvice: The French Quarter and many tourist areas are walkable, though the city is spread out and some neighborhoods require other transport. New Orleans has a historic streetcar network and local bus system covering major corridors, and taxis are generally available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and mild winters with occasional cold snaps and moderate rainfall make January one of the more comfortable months to visit.
February remains mild and is often the heart of Mardi Gras season, with festive crowds and pleasant daytime temperatures.
Spring arrives with warming temperatures and increasing greenery, though rain showers become more frequent.
Warm and pleasant with blooming flora, April is a popular month to visit before the intense summer heat sets in.
Heat and humidity begin to build noticeably in May, with frequent afternoon thunderstorms becoming a regular occurrence.
Hot, humid, and rainy, June marks the start of hurricane season and can feel oppressive outdoors during midday.
July is the hottest and most humid month, with near-daily thunderstorms and peak hurricane season risk.
Conditions remain intensely hot and humid with heavy rainfall, and hurricane risk is at its highest this month.
Still hot and stormy with continued hurricane risk, September offers little relief from the summer's heat and humidity.
October brings welcome cooling and lower humidity, making it one of the most enjoyable months to explore the city.
Mild and comfortable autumn weather with reduced crowds makes November an excellent time to visit New Orleans.
Cool and festive in December, the city celebrates the holiday season with events and decorations while temperatures remain mild.
